techmeme.title: Satellite services provider Globalstar says Apple took a 20% ownership stake worth ~$400M, and has committed another $1.1B to expand satellite service capacity (Benjamin Mayo/9to5Mac)
The capital expenditures of Amazon, Alphabet, Meta, and Microsoft are set to total over $200B in 2024 as companies accelerate spending chasing AI (Bloomberg)
Canalys: global smartphone shipments grew 5% YoY in Q3 to 309.9M units, the strongest Q3 since 2021; Samsung led with 57.5M units, followed by Apple at 54.5M (Canalys)
Crypto firm Immutable says the SEC issued it a Wells notice related to the sale of its IMX tokens in 2021, and accuses the agency of "regulation by enforcement" (Callan Quinn/CoinDesk)
Q&A with Google DeepMind Director John Jumper on winning the Nobel Prize in Chemistry, merging science and AI, advancing AlphaFold, rival labs, and more (Richard Nieva/Forbes)
